messageBody:
background --- i use junit with ant, and my build and unit testing is
automated. for testing i have the testcases in an xml file and the
class that extends the TestCase class reads the xml file and compares
the output of the test case against the expected values (again
specifed along with the input in the xml file)

for each testcase to succeed, the code may have to pass many assert
statements. What i have done is the message parameter of assertTrue
has a sting something like this (expected value=X , actual value=Y)
so that i know which assert failed. so far evrything is fine.

now the problem --- unless and until assertTrue fails, the message
never gets logged. if assert fails i can get the message in the junit
report. is there anyway to log the message even if the asserttrue is
a success so that the junit report has these additional data.

has anyone ever done this? is it possible in the current
implementation of junit. any help is greatly appreciated.
